pr_title: #2301 auto provisioning status properties integration tests

timeline.message:
#2301 Replacing "dummy" implementation of auto-provisioning properties in FileBasedRegistrationService

Signed-off-by: Florian Kaltner <florian.kaltner@bosch.io>

#2301 Adding assertions for auto-provisioning status properties to integration tests

Signed-off-by: Florian Kaltner <florian.kaltner@bosch.io>

timeline.bodyText: is there a reason why this method returns a DeviceDto while forUpdate returns a FileBasedDeviceDto?
timeline.author: sophokles73

replies.bodyText:
Yes, I was reluctant to change the signature of DeviceDto's forUpdate method taking a Supplier as this leads to changes in JDBC and MongoDb registry and I didn't want to do this because of a the file based registry which is just for "playing around" 😐.
But as you said below, it seems like this is too confusing. I adapted the implementation to use FileBasedDeviceDto everywhere.
replies.author: fkaltner

timeline.bodyText: to me it is very confusing that in some places we use DeviceDto while in others we use FileBasedDeviceDto. Can't we only use FileBasedDeviceDto?
timeline.author: sophokles73

timeline.bodyText:
currently, the Device Registry Management API does not require the status property to be present in the response body. It also doesn't mention the autoprovisioned and autoprovisioningnotificationsent property at all.
So, IMHO we need to add these properties to the API spec, if they indeed can be returned by a registry implementation.
timeline.author: sophokles73

replies.bodyText:
Sure, makes sense.
I just became confused again: should the properties be camelCased or kebab-cased? I am asking since I noticed that last-user is kebab-cased the rest is camelCased.
By majority decision counting the properties by case I think it is camelCased? 😄
replies.author: fkaltner

replies.bodyText: camel case, yes. last-user should be changed to lastUser FMPOV. But we will handle that in another issue: #2309
replies.author: sophokles73

timeline.message:
